result.execSummary:
The defendant Talonna Marie Lallas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
- Sign up for probation on 06/29/22 by 03:00PM 
- 2 days credit against ultimate sentence

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Talonna Marie Lallas

records.addlTxt: JOC & ARIPR returned by PO. Return to sender. Unclaimed. Unable to forward. olg
Signed by Both Parties. arc    c: DE

4:22 PM CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson. Prosecuting attorney Michelle P Brekken in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Travis Satorius in court for Talonna Marie Lallas. Defendant Talonna Marie Lallas in court. Court questions Defendant. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands and pleads Guilty to Count 2: Disorderly Conduct- 947.01(1). Court finds that Defendant has freely and voluntarily entered plea and waived rights. Court accepts plea and finds sufficient facts. Court finds Defendant guilty. Upon motion of the State, Court dismisses and read-in Count 1 and 3. Sentencing arguments. 

Court Orders: W/ S 1 Year Probation

- 30 days condition time STAYED
- Court Costs: $243.00. Apply Bond. Balance to be pd through probation
- DNA Surcharge: $200.00. Apply Bond. Balance to be pd through probation
- DNA Sample
- Anger Management Assessment and follow through with recommendations
- Cooperate with any other evaluation, assessment and/or program as requested
- Take medications as prescribed 
- No Contact with Austin B. 
- Follow rules and regulations of Agent
- Pay supervision fees
- Sign up for probation on 06/29/22 by 03:00 PM 

2 days credit against ultimate sentence

Restitution to be held open for 60 days 

Adjourned at

10:38 AM Court Commissioner: Tim Heckmann, Reporter: UNMONITORED DAR. Clerk: K Kittel   ADA:  Michelle P Brekken   DF ATTY:  Travis Satorius   DF:  Talonna Marie Lallas appeared.  Set for PH.   Atty Brekken notes the State will be filing an amended complaint. Atty Satorius enters NG plea on behalf of DE. Court confirms address of DE. Bond continues in form and amount. Adjourned:  10:41 am.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 28, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on June 28, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

pretrial Assessment Report filed by JSS. sf (sealed)
The original document name was titled: Assessment Report
The original history event date is: 04-29-2022
Preliminary hearing on May 12, 2022 at 10:30 am.

-It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, A. Blodgett.   The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands. Waives reading. Waives PH time limits.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 12, 2022 at 10:30 am.
